image.altText: A film photograph of a young woman wearing a RAAF uniform and smiling.

items.synopsis: After almost 40 years, a man has been charged with murder over the disappearance of 21-year-old Debra Campbell, who went missing from her home in Melbourne's south-east in 1984.

title.children: Police charge man with murder over decades-old Melbourne cold case

image.altText: A composite image of a woman in a red jacket and an airplane with the word Qatar on it.

items.synopsis: Federal Transport Minister Catherine King rejected a bid by Qatar Airways to introduce an additional 28 weekly flights into major capital cities on the same day she signed a letter to five Australian women who were invasively strip-searched at a Qatari airport.

title.children: Minister rejected Qatar Airways bid same day she signed letter to women strip-searched at Qatari airport

image.altText: William Tyrrell's former foster parents, with faces blurred, are seen during a break at the Parramatta Local Court

items.synopsis: William Tyrrell's foster mother blamed the pressure of a police investigation for her alleged abuse towards a different child, a court has heard.

title.children: 'You're a bad mother': Court hears more recordings of alleged abuse by Tyrrell foster mother

image.altText: Man in red glasses and blue shirt

items.synopsis: Former ACCC chair Allan Fels says BlueScope deserved its record penalty for attempted cartel behaviour, but warns some companies may factor potential fines into business models — unless they are much higher.

title.children: Former ACCC boss applauds record BlueScope fine for attempted price fixing, calls for higher deterrents

image.altText: a man smiling sitting next to a woman wearing a wedding dress

items.synopsis: Jordan Fineanganofo now faces several other charges relating to incidents that allegedly occurred over an 18-hour period before the Sydney paramedic was stabbed.

title.children: Man charged over Sydney paramedic murder allegedly assaulted woman day before

image.altText: Glen Eira College

items.synopsis: Parents fearful as police investigate whether a group went on an armed robbery spree, targeting school children from Glen Eira College.

title.children: Parents speak of their fears as police step up patrols in the area where a 14yo boy was violently abducted

image.altText: Three men in military uniforms and face masks sit on a tank on Russian street at night. The tank bears the letter Z in red.

items.synopsis: A proscription order will ban people in the UK from being "actively involved" in the group or displaying its logo, the defence secretary says.

title.children: UK to ban Russia's Wagner Group, declaring it a 'terrorist organisation'

image.altText: A space rocket launch vehicle on a rocky island, the picture is taken across the water from the mainland

items.synopsis: Japan is aiming to become the fifth country to land a spacecraft on the lunar surface, with the launch of a low-cost "Moon sniper" that will test precision-landing technology designed to further Tokyo's space goals.

title.children: Japan's 'Moon sniper' to test precision landing

image.altText: An historic paddle wheeler emerges from the brown water of the Thomson River, with salvage crews on pontoons and machinery.

items.synopsis: Harnesses and floaties have been used in a major operation to resurface the 99-year-old paddle wheeler.

title.children: Pride of the Murray resurfaces after six months at the bottom of an outback river

image.altText: Janice Edwards sits on her lounge smiling at the camera with sunglasses on her head in a red shirt and black puffer vest

items.synopsis: The corporate watchdog ASIC fails to convince a judge that collapsed funeral insurer the Aboriginal Community Benefit Fund misled its customers, leaving consumers disappointed.

title.children: 'A slap in the face': ACBF customers disappointed with fine issued to failed funeral insurer

image.altText: An Aboriginal flag in the foreground, Parliament House in the background

items.synopsis: Representatives from a range of peak bodies have travelled to Canberra and spoken with government and crossbench members about the need for a respectful referendum debate, but the ABC understands opposition members have so far refused meetings.

title.children: Coalition members refuse meeting with mental health experts ahead of Voice referendum

image.altText: rundle mall shoppers in rundle mall

items.synopsis: Australia's economy is growing at an annual pace of 2.1 per cent, down from 2.7 per cent at the end of 2022.

title.children: Australia's economy continued to slow in June quarter, households finding it harder to save

image.altText: Kim Jong Un and Vladimir Putin side by side.

items.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un may soon meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Here's what each world leader stands to gain from each other, and what it could mean for Russia's war in Ukraine.

title.children: Money for munitions is the likely end game between Putin and Kim

image.altText: John Pesutto and Moira Deeming in a composite image.

items.synopsis: Moira Deeming has threatened to sue Victorian Liberal leader John Pesutto for defamation after she was kicked out of the party. Mediation between the pair has so far failed.

title.children: Mediation between Victorian Liberal leader John Pesutto and exiled MP Moira Deeming fails

image.altText: Twenty-year-old Johnson Kokozian wearing a cap looking at the camera and smiling

items.synopsis: NSW Police also confirmed two more people had been charged in relation to the crash.

title.children: Driver accused of killing siblings in Sydney crash has dangerous driving charges upgraded

image.altText: A man looks straight ahead with green tinted sunglasses on

items.synopsis: Prosecutors say they are awaiting results of a post-mortem examination of Clare Nowland, 95, who died after allegedly being tasered by police officer Kristian White.

title.children: Officer accused of tasering Cooma great-grandmother Clare Nowland faces court in person

image.altText: Frank Foley

items.synopsis: The discovery comes after police confirmed a breakthrough on Tuesday into the disappearance of Francis "Frank" Foley, offering a  $500,000 reward for information leading to a conviction.

title.children: Police find more human remains in Gemfields murder cold case

image.altText: Four Corners obtained footage showing the tear gassing of boys being held in isolation at the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre in Darwin, in August 201

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court justice orders the NT government to pay more than $200,000 each to four men who were tear gassed when still teenagers in the Darwin detention facility.

title.children: NT government ordered to pay nearly $1 million to former Don Dale inmates tear gassed in 2014

image.altText: Three greyhounds that race on leads at a track in Victoria.

items.synopsis: A trainer and registered person have been suspended and are being investigated following a probe into alleged luring and live-baiting offences.

title.children: Two suspended as Victorian greyhound racing industry investigates live-baiting allegations

image.altText: Promo image of a line chart showing housing costs broken down by income.

items.synopsis: Housing costs are at record highs, and we can show you who is bearing the brunt of the crisis.

title.children: Where you sit on this chart determines your level of housing stress

image.altText: A man lays in a hospital bed as an elderly woman holds his hand

items.synopsis: Gavin Hicks was spooked by the death of professional cyclist Jason Lowndes on a road outside Bendigo. Six years later, he was seriously injured in a collision on the same road.

title.children: Cyclist hit by car on same Victorian road where elite rider died calls for new speed limit

image.altText: ACT Chief Police Officer Neil Gaughan.

items.synopsis: Police patrolling Canberra's nightlife precincts are being told to change how they respond to witnessing drug use, ahead of next month's nation-leading decriminalisation laws coming into effect.

title.children: 'They're going to see people take coke': Top cop says ACT police are changing their attitudes to drugs ahead of decriminalisation

image.altText: A woman squats down in a crop

items.synopsis: The Victorian Farmers Federation remains in turmoil as about 200 members support a second call for an extraordinary general meeting in an attempt to dissolve the board and spill elected positions.

title.children: Victorian farm lobby president rejects second spill motion, as claims of personal attacks run rife

image.altText: Vanessa Hudson, the incoming Qantas CEO, with model plane in foreground showing Flying Kangaroo

items.synopsis: With Alan Joyce announcing his abrupt departure from Qantas two months ahead of schedule, Vanessa Hudson is now in control of an airline with a reputation problem — and disgruntled customers say it will be tough to win them back.

title.children: New Qantas CEO Vanessa Hudson faces an uphill battle to restore the public's faith as Alan Joyce departs

image.altText: A close up of Newell Convers Wyeth's painting Ramona, frontispiece illustration (Señora Gonzaga Moreno and Ramona)

items.synopsis: The owner joked that it might have been a "real painting" when she bought it, but an internet search proved fruitless. Six years later, a Facebook post changed all that.

title.children: A woman bought this painting in a US op shop for $6. It's expected to fetch $385,000

image.altText: A woman in a blue jacket speaking in a corridor with a light above her head

items.synopsis: The party is crucial to the revised plan's passage through the Senate, but it says there are still not enough guarantees around the return of water to the environment.

title.children: Greens won't support revised Murray Darling Basin Plan in current form

image.altText: A large, dark-coloured bull in a pen.

items.synopsis: The sellers had listed Shady with a reserve of $6,000 and say they still can't quite believe the result of the auction in NSW.

title.children: Australian bull sets world record price with 'mind-blowing' $150k sale

image.altText: A man in a yellow raincoat lifting a branch out of calf-deep water.

items.synopsis: Storm Daniel batters parts of Greece, Türkiye and Bulgaria just days after a deadly wildfire was brought under control in the north of Greece.

title.children: Greece had the largest wildfire ever recorded in the EU. Now, it's grappling with floods

image.altText: Vales Point Power Station sits to the right of image over lake on a clear blue day. Smoke comes out of building.

items.synopsis: The NSW Environment Protection Authority alleges Delta Electricity, which owns Vales Point Power Station, is responsible for the deaths of thousands of fish at Mannering Park in 2022.

title.children: Environment watchdog takes legal action against power station over 'horrific' Lake Macquarie fish kill

image.altText: A over the shoulder shot of a woman whose back is towards the camera, looking at an old vacant church building.

items.synopsis: A woman says she feels "devastated" after vandals caused about $15,000 worth of damage to the 153-year-old church she is renovating into an Airbnb.

title.children: Vandals trash historical church being renovated into Airbnb

image.altText: People standing around two orange body bags.

items.synopsis: It is understood the lift fell about 100 metres before it crashed on the ground.

title.children: Resort workers reportedly die in elevator crash at Bali resort

image.altText: A woman with blue shirt and name tag sits looking up at and holding the knee of a woman who sits on a raised bed.

items.synopsis: Australia has one of the world's best healthcare systems. But senior physician Fiona Reilly argues it doesn't always work as well as it should for patients.

title.children: It only takes 11 seconds for a doctor to interrupt a patient. A simple shift could change things

image.altText: Two male soldiers in slouch hats and formal uniform

items.synopsis: More than two years after Craftsman Brendon Payne and Warrant Officer Ryan Leslie were killed during a training exercise, the Department of Defence has been charged with failing to ensure their health and safety. The charge carries a maximum penalty of $1.5 million.

title.children: Defence charged over 2021 truck rollover that killed two soldiers

image.altText: a bown/green turtle on sand with sun behind

items.synopsis: About 100 metres from the end of a runway earmarked to take spy planes for the Australian Defence Force and its allies, hundreds of vulnerable turtles are starving and dying.

title.children: In the 1990s, this reef was teeming with 'fat' turtles. Now they are starving
